item.title: 丰业银行收购 KeyCorp 更多股份获美联储批准
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会周四表示，新斯科舍银行可以将其在总部位于俄亥俄州的 KeyCorp 的持股比例从 4.93% 增至 14.99%。【原文：The Bank of Nova Scotia can increase its stake in Ohio-based KeyCorp from 4.93% to as much as 14.99%, the US Federal Reserve said on Thursday.】

item.title: 人工智能推动销售额增长，博通盈利超出预期
item.description: 苹果公司和其他大型科技公司的芯片供应商博通公司（Broadcom Inc.【原文：Broadcom Inc., a chip supplier for Apple Inc. and other big tech companies, posted better-than-expected profit in the fourth quarter after artificial intelligence demand helped bolster growth.】

item.title: 新泽西无人机之谜引发联邦调查局调查，居民歇斯底里
item.description: 伊朗母舰？外星人活动？过于执着的爱好者？【原文：An Iranian mothership? Alien activity? Overly-dedicated hobbyists?】

item.title: 费城联储预计美国第二季度就业人数疲软
item.description: 费城联邦储备银行估计，美国第二季度的就业情况明显弱于劳工统计局的官方数据。【原文：The Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia estimates that US employment in the second quarter was significantly weaker in the second quarter than official figures from the Bureau of Labor Statistics show.】

item.title: 松桥警告：供不应求导致信贷风险上升
item.description: PineBridge 投资公司表示，对日益减少的垃圾债发行量的需求激增，增加了信贷市场发生事故的风险。【原文：Soaring demand for a dwindling amount of junk-debt issuance is increasing the risk of credit market mishaps, says PineBridge Investments.】

item.title: OpenAI 首席财务官称下一个尖端人工智能模型将耗资数十亿美元
item.description:
这家初创公司将投入更多资金来构建先进的人工智能系统，并可能对某些服务收取更高的费用。【原文：

The startup is spending more to build advanced artificial intelligence systems and may charge more for some services. 

】

item.title: 三菱电机探索在日本建立功率芯片联盟
item.description: 三菱电机公司首席执行官表示，该公司正与国内竞争对手就合作开发电源芯片进行谈判。【原文：Mitsubishi Electric Corp. is in talks with domestic rivals about teaming up on power chips, its chief executive officer said, advocating Japanese alliances on the manufacture of a crucial component that drives the world’s devices.】

item.title: 就业市场动荡，受过教育的中国年轻人转向导游行业
item.description: 越来越多的中国年轻人因白领工作前景不稳定而考取导游资格证书，并希望国内度假热潮能带来稳定的收入。【原文：A growing number of young Chinese are getting certified to become tour guides, driven by unstable job prospects in white-collar work and hopeful that a domestic vacation boom will provide steady pay.】

item.title: 纽约机场为明年创纪录的 1.5 亿旅客做好准备
item.description: 在需求增长和国际旅行回升的推动下，航空旅行持续飙升，超过了大流行前的水平，纽约市地区的机场正准备在 2025 年迎来创纪录的乘客数量。【原文：New York City area airports are bracing for record-breaking passenger numbers in 2025 as air travel continues to surge past pre-pandemic levels, fueled by growing demand and a rebound in international travel.】

item.title: 数据中心 DigiCo REIT 将在澳大利亚 2018 年以来最大 IPO 后亮相
item.description: 数据中心运营商 DigiCo Infrastructure REIT 首次公开发行 20 亿澳元（13 亿美元）股票，是澳大利亚六年多来最大的一次，其股票将于周五在悉尼开始交易。【原文：Shares of data center operator DigiCo Infrastructure REIT are set to start trading in Sydney on Friday after a A$2 billion ($1.3 billion) initial public offering that was Australia’s biggest in more than six years.】

item.title: 被困隧道的纽约地铁乘客显示了老化系统的局限性
item.description: 在数千名纽约市地铁乘客因停电而被困在布鲁克林地铁地下两个多小时后的一天，交通官员表示，这一事件说明迫切需要对老化的地铁系统进行现代化改造。【原文：A day after thousands of New York City subway riders were stuck underground in Brooklyn for more than two hours due to a power outage, transit officials said the incident illustrates the dire need to modernize the aging system.】

item.title: 法国 Altice 债权人在未达成债务协议的情况下离开巴黎
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Altice 法国公司和一批有担保债权人在削减该公司 237 亿欧元（249 亿美元）债务的协议条款上仍存在分歧，包括亿万富翁老板 Patrick Drahi 应该放弃多少股权。【原文：Altice France and a group of secured creditors remain at odds over the terms of a deal to cut the company’s €23.7 billion ($24.9 billion) debt pile, including how much equity billionaire owner Patrick Drahi should give up, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: IBM 新投资推动芝加哥量子园区发展
item.description: 伊利诺伊州州长 JB-普利兹克（JB Pritzker）再次赢得胜利，因为国际商业机器公司（International Business Machines Corp.【原文：Illinois Governor JB Pritzker has scored another win as International Business Machines Corp. is investing in the state’s new quantum and microelectronics park in Chicago.】

item.title: 巴西航天工业因陷入困境的卢拉获胜而得到推动
item.description: 巴西立法者批准了一项发展国家航天工业的计划，这为陷入困境的总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）在面临个人和政治健康挫折时带来了一场胜利。【原文：Brazilian lawmakers approved a plan to develop the country’s space industry, providing embattled President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva with a victory as he faces setbacks to his personal and political health.】

item.title: 如果特朗普发动贸易战，加拿大考虑对铀和石油征收出口税
item.description: 如果即将上任的美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁征收广泛的关税，加拿大正在研究对出口到美国的主要商品征收出口税，其中包括铀、石油和钾肥。【原文：Canada is examining the use of export taxes on major commodities it exports to the US — including uranium, oil and potash — if incoming President Donald Trump carries out his threat to impose broad tariffs.】

item.title: Suzano 将纸浆需求困境归咎于中国卫生纸的转变
item.description: 过去十年间，中国对卫生纸的需求不断增长，使 Suzano SA 成为世界上最大的木浆出口商。【原文：Growing Chinese demand for toilet paper over the past decade has helped make Suzano SA the world’s top exporter of wood pulp.】

item.title: 精神航空新票据揭示市场对债务交易的焦虑
item.description: 精神航空公司（Spirit Airlines Inc. ）的部分债券持有人在一笔 8.4 亿美元的融资交易中获得了特殊保护，这笔交易有望推动该航空公司摆脱破产境地，从而使他们免受某些类型的财务重组的影响，近年来，这些重组因偏袒某些债权人而使债务投资者感到不安。【原文：Certain Spirit Airlines Inc. bondholders obtained special protection in a $840 million financing deal poised to propel the airline out of bankruptcy, guarding them from certain types of financial restructurings that have roiled debt investors in recent years by favoring some creditors over others.】

item.title: 欧洲央行准备在未来两次会议上降息四分之一点子
item.description: 据熟悉欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）决策者想法的官员透露，由于通胀率稳定在 2% 的目标水平，而经济增长仍然疲软，他们预计 1 月份将再降息四分之一个百分点，3 月份可能也会降息。【原文：European Central Bank policymakers expect to cut interest rates by another quarter point in January and probably also in March as inflation stabilizes at the 2% target and economic growth remains sluggish, according to officials familiar with their thinking.】

item.title: 洛克菲勒通过新基金进一步涉足高收益债券市场
item.description: 洛克菲勒资产管理公司（Rockefeller Asset Management）推出了一只专注于高收益市政债券的封闭式区间基金，这再次表明该公司在风险较高的州和地方债务领域的雄心壮志。【原文：Rockefeller Asset Management launched a closed-end interval fund focused on higher-yielding municipal bonds, in yet another sign of the firm’s ambitions to grow its footprint in riskier state and local debt.】

item.title: 倒闭的金融科技贷款公司 Stenn 大部分员工将失业
item.description: 上周，汇丰控股公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）将这家陷入困境的贸易金融公司推向破产，Stenn Technologies 公司的大部分员工将失去工作。【原文：Most of Stenn Technologies’ employees will lose their jobs after HSBC Holdings Plc pushed the troubled trade-finance firm into insolvency last week.】

item.title: 索尼 Bungie 视频游戏部门遭今年早些时候被解雇的高级总监起诉
item.description:
克里斯托弗-巴雷特（Christopher Barrett）曾是 Bungie 公司的高级管理人员，直到今年早些时候他被指控行为不当而突然被解雇。【原文：

Christopher Barrett was a top executive at Bungie until he was suddenly fired earlier this year after he was accused of misconduct.

】

item.title: OpenAI 的 ChatGPT 将实时响应视频源
item.description: OpenAI 赋予聊天机器人 ChatGPT 实时处理并向用户讲述它在视频中观察到的内容的能力，这距离它首次预告该功能已经过去了七个月。【原文：OpenAI is giving chatbot ChatGPT the ability to process and speak to users about what it observes in video feeds in real time, seven months after it first teased the feature.】

item.title: 鸡蛋通胀让美国顶级生产商 Cal-Maine 股价上涨 127
item.description: 由于鸡蛋价格上涨加剧了美国消费者的通货膨胀，生产商股票为投资者带来了超额回报。【原文：As higher egg prices add to inflation for US consumers, producer shares are providing investors with outsized returns.】

item.title: 就业预期持续减弱
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 迈克-于谈一键式抵押贷款的问题
item.description:
软件系统和法规如何变成堆积如山的文书工作？【原文：

How software systems and regulations turn into mountains of paperwork.

】

item.title: 欧洲利率走低，准备迎接另一个特朗普时代
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普第二次入主白宫后，欧洲各国央行坚决转向鸽派，以帮助各经济体抵御更多干扰。【原文：Europe’s central banks are taking a determined dovish turn to aid economies bracing for more disruption from Donald Trump’s second stint in the White House.】

item.title: 苹果公司即将为 iPhone 和家用设备改用自制蓝牙和 Wi-Fi 芯片
item.description: 苹果公司（Apple Inc. ）雄心勃勃地计划为其设备制造内部组件，包括从明年开始改用国产芯片进行蓝牙和 Wi-Fi 连接，此举将取代目前由 Broadcom Inc.【原文：Apple Inc.’s ambitious plan to create in-house components for its devices will include switching to a homegrown chip for Bluetooth and Wi-Fi connections starting next year, a move that will replace some parts currently provided by Broadcom Inc.】

item.title: 顶级经济学家称中国未来几年将增长 3%-4% 左右
item.description: 一位著名的中国经济学家表示，中国经济的增长速度可能比官方数据显示的要慢，未来几年大约 3% 到 4% 的扩张速度可能是一个现实的前景。【原文：China’s economy likely grows slower than official figures suggest, and a rate of expansion of around 3% to 4% is probably a realistic outlook for the coming years, according to a prominent Chinese economist.】

item.title: ServiceTitan 股价飙升 42%，市场首现大片效应
item.description: 在这家住宅和商业维修软件公司募集到 6.248 亿美元资金后，ServiceTitan Inc.【原文：ServiceTitan Inc. shares opened 42% above their initial public offering price after the residential and commercial repair software company raised $624.8 million.】

item.title: S&P 500 指数创纪录涨势出现裂痕，多数股票被排除在外
item.description: 在股市屡创新高的背后，是一些华尔街策略师担忧的趋势：支撑股市上涨的股票越来越少。【原文：Beneath a stock market that goes from one record to the next lies a concerning trend for some Wall Street strategists: Fewer stocks are buttressing the advance.】
